title: Cant login with home internet
body:
So over the past 2 days if i try to login with my home internet (Telstra) It get stuck on logging on for 3-4 minutes and then displays connection error.
It was working fine 3 days ago nothing changed on my pc (can confirm it does the same on different pc)
The thing is if i use my phones internet (Optus) it works fine. Any ideas what might cause this?
Things i tried: restart pc/router/client, disable ip helper, change dns servers to google ones, repair lol.
nothing works....
i should note, after many attempts sometimes it does log in, but then it cannot connect to chat or game

replies.body:
Hey.

Just explaining my thought process here, this is how I'm thinking about where the problem could be.

Potential sources for the issue:
1) Your Computer.  Unlikely, since your computer works if you switch to using your phone.
2) Home Network.  Possible -> switching to your phone bypasses this.
3) Local ISP Issues.  Possible -> switching to your phone bypasses this.
4) Backbone ISP issues.  Possible -> likely as we are not seeing widespread problems from Telstra.
5) LoL Server issues.  Possible, but again less likely as connecting to the server works from your phone.

It seems like you have tried most of [the obvious stuff](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) - and providing traceroutes is a great first step.  The traces you have so far are to our OCE game servers though, so login problems will be hitting a different set of servers.  Try running a traceto the following urls:

* lq.oc1.lol.riotgames.com
* chat.oc1.lol.riotgames.com

Once you have done that, you can also try using telnet to connect directly to those services, and make sure that you are able to hit them at all.  (Instructions for enabling telnet in windows [here](http://www.itworld.com/software/227783/enable-telnet-windows-8))

In a command prompt: 
telnet chat.oc1.lol.riotgames.com 5223
(post if you get a "connect failed" or "connection timed out" error)

telnet lq.oc1.lol.riotgames.com 443
(post if you get a "connect failed" or "connection timed out" error)

You won't see any meaningful output from these commands, but what you need to look for is to make sure they do not fail with a timeout or other issue.

A couple of other checks - 

* Have you tried connecting to your router via a cable (not wifi)
* Do you have any kind of VPN software on your computer that might be interfering with its networking?

Thanks for the response.

All PC's on the network have the same problem so its not a computer configuration issue
Home network was fine for 1-2 years only for a few weeks this problem started - No change in configuration
No VPN or proxy
Steam login seems to be affected as well for some reason

telnet to  chat.oc1.lol.riotgames.com shows no output
lq.oc1.lol.riotgames.com expects input and terminates with 400 Bad request


For some reason i can't attach more than one file so i will paste tracerootes here

I have the same problem. I called Telstra an they dont know what to do about it.
I also cant connect to Steam. 
Its defs a Telstra issue cause i connected with my phone.
